Modification_Detail.description: Extracted metadata from PDS3 catalog and modified to comply with PDS4 Information Model (Depricated).
Changed inst LIDs from u:n:p:c:i:instID.scID to u:n:p:c:i:scID.instID And per "Guide toPDS4 Context Products" v1.7, changed all lidvid_reference to lid_reference
Custom update by K. Lopez (SBN) to improve information and metadata.

External_Reference.reference_text: Beichman, C.A., G. Neugebauer, H.J. Habing, P.E. Clegg, and T.J. Chester, 1988, Infrared Astronomical Satellite Catalog and Atlases, Volume 1, Explanatory Supplement, NASA RP-1190.
Boulanger, F., Gain and offset corrections for ZOHF Version 3, IRAS Circular, December 28, 1988.
Moshir, M., Et al., Explanatory Supplement to the IRAS Faint Source Survey, (Pasadena:JPL), 1989.
Oken, C.A., Gautier, T.N., and Wheelock, S.L., Version 3 of the Zodiacal History File, IRAS Circular, December 28, 1988.

Instrument.name: Focal Plane Array
Instrument.description: The IRAS Focal Plane Array (FPA) was located at the focal plane of the IRAS Ritchey-Chretien telescope. The focal plane assembly contained the survey detectors, visible star sensors for position reconstruction, a Low Resolution Spectrometer (LRS) and a Chopped Photometric Channel (CPC).
